reviews.text:
Wonderful historical place to visit at morning. You can even visit it at night and enjoy the weather and the sound of the waves hitting the rocks while watching the citadel shining at night in yellow colours. 
Drinking some tea or eating grilled corn will be a good idea. 
Nearby the citadel, there is an aquarium and museums.

Most beautiful and historic attraction in Alexandria. On the bank of Mediterranean Sea, you will enjoy the place most. The architectural design as well as historical importance of the Citadel is  the main attraction, beauty of the sea is extra bonus for the Tourists. Must visiting place in Alexandria is this place.

Magnificent medieval sea-shore  monument. Its beauty can't be expressed. It was a privilege to watch this great place, especially, inside the palace. Air passage, staircase, prayer room, tiny bed rooms all amazing. Watching the Mediterranean sea and its high tide through the wall window standing inside the citadel was an unforgettable experience.
What a fun place to visit. Really great views of Alexandria too. If you can try to go right when it opens, otherwise it gets pretty crowded. Make sure to explore the entire complex as well.

Quite nice. Entrance is from the side. You'll get kicked out about half an hour before the place closes so come earlier. 
It's really cool actually and you can learn about the history of the lighthouse before it in the local museum.
My only issue was that some of the rooms inside were clearly being used as toilets from the smell of piss and the wetness of the floor. Quite disgusting.

Pretty decently preserved site in the middle of the city. It has pillars and monuments from all parts of Egypt. The pillar has been transported from Aswan in the ancient times and stands tall and proud in the center of the site. There are a lot of other gargoyles that represent ancient Egyptian , Roman and Greek culture. The ticket window person is super rude to tourists considering it's a tourist site and it runs on the revenues from the tickets.

Pompey's Pillar is a Roman triumphal column in Alexandria, Egypt, the largest of its type constructed outside the imperial capitals of Rome and Constantinople. Pompey’s Pillar hewn from red Aswan granite, one of the city’s prime sights is a single tapered stone structure. The column rises out of the sparse ruins of the Temple of Serapeum, a magnificent structure that stood here in ancient times. The column was named by travellers to remember the murder of the Roman general Pompey by Cleopatra’s brother, but an inscription at the base says it was erected in AD 291 to support a statue of the emperor Diocletian.

Pompeys pillar is good to watch if you are visiting the Alexandria. Your guide will explain the stories related to it. It's very well preserved in the ruins. Moving up to it involves little ruined steps up from front otherwise there is a long way to reach at top too.
Impressive and massive granite column. You can imagine how this site will look in his good days. Flanked by 2 beautiful Sphinxes. Must visit
Amazing historical site. Make sure you read the sheets on the board beside the entrance if you go without a guide as they provide information about the site.

A very good place for those who like color and green plants. 
Wide and open place for children and your family. 
Quite place for relaxation time. 
If you want to walk, this place very good for you.

Quiet place. 
Charged us 25 EGP/person .
it’s alongside the beach but with minimal spots having direct sea view.
No entrance to the palace but you can walk around and take photos

A v.good place for those who like the green color.
Wide and open place for your family and children.
You can enjoy walking alongside the beach without swimming.
A magnificent place. It should be considered part of the world heritage
Marvelous gardens and open areas for children and outdoor activities ... Ticket is 25 LE per person or car.

A very good place for those who like color and green plants. 
Wide and open place for children and your family. 
Quite place for relaxation time. 
If you want to walk, this place very good for you.

Quiet place. 
Charged us 25 EGP/person .
it’s alongside the beach but with minimal spots having direct sea view.
No entrance to the palace but you can walk around and take photos

A v.good place for those who like the green color.
Wide and open place for your family and children.
You can enjoy walking alongside the beach without swimming.
A magnificent place. It should be considered part of the world heritage
Marvelous gardens and open areas for children and outdoor activities ... Ticket is 25 LE per person or car.

Disaster, as most of all historical sites in Egypt. Why? Because no one knows anything about these places. Neither internet nor the Egyptian authorities. The place is CLOSED UNDER RENOVATION...as here in Egypt planning is non existent, who knows when it will open again? Very disappointing in general Alexandria, the most important and last city of the Egyptian Empire and all its neglected and not even in 5 stars hotels anyone knows which places are of historical value neither whether their open or closed. I want to rate the Ministry of Antiquities a 0 for their disgraceful management and unforgivable estate of most of the  historical sites in country.

The museum was closed and there was a multitude of rubbish surrounding it. Don't waste your time going here as you will not find anything worth seeing.. not sure why it is not marked as being closed on Google yet.
The museum has been closed for a long time for no obvious reason.
I heard this museum is better than others, but it was repaired since 10 years.
I went there yesterday (25th of November 2017) and still closed. The place is falling apart, doesn't seems that it's a reform happening.

It is one of the best oceanography institute in world. It was founded on 1 January 1966, it has regional centres in Kochi, Mumbai and vizag.
The institute has a sanctioned strength of 200 scientists and 100 technical support staff. The major research areas include the four traditional branches of oceanography - biological, chemical, geological/geophysical, and physical – as well as ocean engineering, marine instrumentation and marine archaeology.
best place for school trips in goa
One of the primear institute in the field of oceanography. Public entry is restricted
One of the best oceanography institute in India
One of the best research institute in the area of oceanography.

The mosque inside is beautiful and serene. But 2 major problems. 1 the washroom is way too dirty and poorly maintained.
And most importantly, inside the mosque it has tomb of someone.

Went here about 4 years ago, the mosque is huge with authentic & seasoned decorations inside. Also contained inside is the tomb of Abu Abbas El-Morsy, a Sufi saint that was regarded as one of the four master saints of Egypt (in the times of Islamic Andalusia). It is considered as one of the most important Islamic historical site in Alexandria.

The prayer hall is huge & comfortable, the toilets & ablution areas are well-managed. There's plenty of parking spaces so don't worry if you come by vehicles. There is also an interesting market complex downstairs to the mosque besides it (although they're not always open).

The Abu al-Abbas al-Mursi Mosque (Arabic: جامع أبو العباس المرسي‎) is an Egyptian mosque in the city of Alexandria. It is dedicated to the 13th century Murcian Andalusi Sufi saint Abul Abbas al-Mursi, whose tomb it contains.

It is located in the Anfoushi neighborhood of Alexandria, near the Citadel of Qaitbay.

The mosque was redesigned and built in today's current form by Eugenio Valzania and Mario Rossi in the years 1929/1945, and was highly influenced by Egypt's Old Cairo buildings and architecture.
I loved the place so much. The decoration is really awesome and I felt so comfortable inside.
Huge place and the decorations are really amazing peaceful place and people are very friendly

The Library of Alexandria was incredible. They offer free guided tours around the library. It only took about 30-35 minutes and gave a brief overview of the entire library. The guide explained all of the different exhibits that the museum houses as well as the history behind the design of the Library. You could spend hours here, but overall it is a must visit. The outside of the Library contains many different scripts.

The history behind this place is breathtaking. You actually can almost feel it in the air. It is very well organized and they offer free guide tours every half hour. You should also check the museum while there.

The library of Alexandria is amazing. There were guided tours of the library offered, however we did not partake. You are able to explore and wander around the library on your own. There are art exhibits and artifacts in the lower part of the the library. The books are in multiple languages and have broad subjects

The Bibliotheca Alexandrina is a major library and cultural center located on the shore of the Mediterranean Sea in the Egyptian city of Alexandria. The Library of Alexandria was reborn in October 2002 to reclaim the mantle of its ancient namesake. It is an extraordinarily beautiful building and also a vast complex where the arts, history, philosophy, and science come together. The BA Libraries, the heart and hub of the BA, provide a space for knowledge seekers. In addition to the Main Library, the BA comprises six specialized libraries.

A building with very interesting architecture, the irregular shapes are impressive and everything has a meaning. I recommend the guided tour and enter the papyrus room although this is an extra payment. It is a reference point of Alexandria and it is worth visiting.
Best shawarma in Alex. No seating  but some available in next door coffee shop.
High food quality
I loved the place, very delicious food and friendly staff
Food is good. Prices are high
Very nice place to have a meal😊

Most of the food is great. Get موسى مقلي and دنيس زيت وليمون. Shrimps aren't all that great so feel free to skip them; they overcook the shrimps. The calimari is nice. Prices are okay. In groups, you can have a really good meal for about 80 pounds. And maybe 100 for an even greater meal. A bit crowded most of the time so expect to get your meal in 30 to 60 minutes not immediately so plan accordingly  

Pro tip: when you go to pick your fish, know exactly what you want. They don't like it when you are hesitant and usually there is a line behind you so be respectful of others.

Very good fish market, taste like home clocking, shrimps and mussels are very good.
The sitting is not good, it's a bublic street shop, but always full and people go their from all over the country.
When you are in Alexandria it's good to try it.

The fish was fresh and the plates were mouthwatering but when it comes to the cleanliness of the plates and spoons they're extremely dirty and sitting inside the restaurant is like sitting in a  bathroom also the bathroom is very dirty and  i didn't wash my hands from the grimy soap, there are cats everywhere and cats jump on chairs while you're eating. I think i will never go there again!
Not a fancy place, but great food, delicious plates. Good value for money and not expensive.

Don’t think of even trying!!! Very dirty place, cats all over the restaurant waiting for food from tables and customers already having their meal! And after all fish & food quality is poor to very poor.
Used to be a good restaurant but i think closed now
Elegant and classic restaurant in downtown Alexandria one of the oldest places in alexandria also offer stella and allow smoking
quite place, good service, Good Food, friendly atmosphere.
An old place holding a lot of memories from Alexandria's golden era.. Alcoholic drinks are served even if they're not listed on the menu...moderate prices and tasty different plates and pizzas

Its a historical restaurant and a place from the cosmopolitan era of the city of Alexandria.
It used to have  its own Greek style in the past and it used to serve middle eastern and Greek dishes and delicious pizzas and it serves spiritual drinks. 
After innovations it lost some of its originality in the opinion of the famous diner goers but from the the inside its still cozy 

By the way it has some historical paintings for famous European artists.
It is no more Pastroudis now is called Abu El Sied

I had a full seafood meal with Mahalabiya in oven as a dessert. the experience felt amazing especially when you choose the fish yourself and make sure they are fresh.
The prices were good as seafood in Alexandria

This is a great restaurant, especially for fish lovers. Seating area is huge and service is great for the huge size of the restaurant. Not a very formal restaurant. You will see lot of Egyptian culture.

I liked this place, it has very large place for all different grilled plates. I went particularly to the sea food section, The prices are reasonable or cheap. The staff are friendly. The place is consider clean. I do recommend this place if you are visiting Alexandria. You will find coffee shops near by the area.
Delesous food , affordable prices and service on time
Great taste. I strongly recommend if you want to eat fish, red meat or chicken
very good

The food was extraordinary. Absolutely delicious. Alcohol is also served. Great list of wines and beer. The service is prompt. Very clean and one of the most amazing views in Alexandria. Takes you back in time where traces of cosmopolitan Alexandria are more than just obvious. The decoration is fantastic. Prices are high, but you get what you pay for.

Would never hesitate to rate this restaurant as "perfect" and give it 10 stars
The staff are super nice, food is yummy and the venue is cosy
Expensive but deserves each pound
Highly recommended
Perfect place for lunch and dinner.
Great place for shisha
Very good decorations and food, yet it's a before sunset restaurant. It's problem is about the lack of variety in hot drinks and it's extremely high prices.

Best Chinese restaurant in Northern Virginia. My wife and I have tried them all and this is consistently the best. It’s also one of the nicest as far as staff, decor, ambience, etc. if you’re dining in, although they do a lot of carry out business also. Peking duck is second to none. We’ve been coming here over 20 years and most of the staff has been there longer than that.

We used to go here regularly, years ago (decades ago, in fact), and it was one of our favourites.  This evening, it was still every bit as good as I remembered.  The service is prompt, attentive, and friendly.  The place is clean, but intimate and cozy.  And - the food remains the best overall Chinese food in the area, in my opinion.  It is pricy, but I never feel cheated here when it comes time to pay.
Very delicious!  I did carryout & it was fast.  It's a popular place so there were 8-10 people ahead of me.  I got sesame shrimp & vegetable lo mein - YUM.

Service is excellent; the staff is very attentive, even on a busy Saturday evening. The food is delicious and the portions are large enough that we brought home leftovers for dinner the next day. Highly recommend House of Dynasty!

This has been our family's favorite restaurant for years. We always bring our family/friends here when they come to town or when we're celebrating for special occasions. It's a little pricey, but worth every penny. It has fantastic service and a great atmosphere. If you decide to do take-out instead (which is an option), you'll never be able to eat take-out from anywhere else -- the food is phenomenal. Family favorites include the Orange Chicken, Cashew Shrimp, Cashew Chicken, and the Wonton Soup.

Nice restaurant with good view of Old Town. Food was great, though the bottom sides of my fish fillets on the fish & chips were slightly soggy compared to the nice crispy top sides. Still good nonetheless. Also ordered the peel & eat shrimp as an appetizer. Nice big pieces of shrimp cooked perfectly. I could do with a little less of the buttery sauce that it sits in though. All in all, good food, good service - I'll be back.

So being from the Midwest we are not able to get fresh seafood usually. So when on one of the coasts, seafood is a must! Ordered the Fisherman’s platter, which had fish, shrimp and scallops with fries. All were good, but I felt the scallops were the best I’ve ever had! Not rubbery, very soft and tasty. Sad there were only two on the plate! All in all, this would have been a 5-star, except I felt the portion size was less than the price should have suggested.

Nice restaurant in Old Town. Good selection of dishes, service was friendly but nothing wowed me.  I would be happy to eat here again as I enjoyed the food but felt it could have been better executed.  I had the fish tacos and while the fish portion was very generous the other accompaniments felt a little overwhelmed.  It is a fish market so maybe it's just me?
The food was fresh and tasty. I had a big plate of mixed seafood. The crab cake and the grilled veggies was yummy. Atmosphere was nice and busy. Great selection of beers.

So disappointed with my small Captains plate for $26.00!!! I got two shrimp, one oyster, one scallop and a fish fillet.  I used to share the small platter!!! What happened???? I told the server that he should let customers know how small the portion is now!!!  The flavor was good and the rest of my party enjoyed their lobsters and Cobb salad or I would have rated it a 1.  This has always been one of our favorite places to bring out of town guests.

So, yesterday, after enjoying our Free Ice Cream Cone at Ben & Jerry's, me and my friends headed over to the Hard Times Cafe for dinner.  Now, we had eaten there before, a long time ago, and we were looking forward to our meal.  First off, the staff was friendly and welcoming.  The waiter asked, right off the bat, if we wanted separate checks - which was nice because we did.  The cafe wasn't too busy, it was a little after 7 PM, so there was no waiting.
I had the 5-way Chili Mac with Veggie Chili and a Diet Coke.  They started us out with corn bread after serving us our drinks and our food was served pretty quickly and was tasty.  Afterwards, even though I shouldn't have, I ordered a Reese's Peanut Butter Pie.  To be honest I was full but the dessert menu looked so good!  And the pie was perfect - with whipped cream and some chocolate syrup. 
Overall the price wasn't that bad either, even including the tip.  I have to say the Hard Times Cafe is one of those places where you CAN visit it a few times a season without worrying about your wallet and just enjoy the food.  Also, it is far enough away from the Waterfront NOT to be too crowded or filled with tourists.  But it also means it is close to the King Street Station when you need to get back home via one of the buses or the subway.  As we all had to get home via public transport it was nice that we were served so quickly and were so close to the station.  Yet, we never felt rushed!  I wish I could give them more stars - I have been to a few Hard Times Cafe and have NEVER been disappointed.

This is a pretty simple little place. It's a chain, or it used to be. Most or all of the other locations have closed. They serve Tex-Mex bar food, mainly chili. They have four kinds of chili, including vegetarian. They also serve Shiner Bock beer from Texas. The servers are all very nice and helpful. Good for a quick bite or a relaxing beer. The chili, cheese and spaghetti 3-way is filling, but could do with a little less spaghetti and more chili and cheese.

Great flavors of chili. Texas, Cincinnati, red Texas, and vegetarian. We loved them all. The homemade cornbread was delicious. The only thing I would have liked better were the beans to be cooked longer. They were too hard when biting into them. I had the five-way chili. Absolute delicacy!

I understand that it has been around for quite some time but the place just feels dark and dirty and not in a cool dive bar kind of way.  Had their chili (Texas style not their signature one) it was ok.  Not unhappy but not excited about going back either
This place has truly awesome chili choices! They also serve a bowl of water tots with chili, cheese, and sour cream... Oh my gosh, so good!

It was the best meal I had in Alexandria, but also the most expensive one. But you also known for what you are paying for. Staff is great, food was great too. Once a time is good to have some luxury meal. And if you will be in Alexandria you need to try it.
Actually great
Fabulous food and great service tonight. The chefs did an amazing job with the eggplant Parmesan and my seafood risotto was great!
Best Italian restaurant
Good place for everything you need
Great atmosphere, delicious food, excellent service and really clean. The only negative thing is the few options on the menu.
Good
The place is small yet has a great view by the sea. The food is pretty tasty and the service is good enough.

I called to inquire about the availability of wifi at the cafe as we are having a business meeting and the person who attended my call said yes we have but limited then he asked a wired stupid question!!! "You will eat and drink" Seriously!!! No i will bring my own lunchbox. I'm wondering what type of hospitality training he received !!!
Beautiful place with a beautiful ambience....usually serene....nice music....tasty food...great hospitality....chic though modern.....LOVE IT
It is a good place for meeting friends and group gathering  .. not expensive and offer elegent service
Service is so bad, drinks are poor quality and price is so overrated
awesome place to hang out and food is great staff is very friendly and efficient

A small cozy little place with a wide variety of food. Can't really call it Italian though. I ordered the chicken bbq pizza which was perfectly cooked but not a lot of chicken on it. The quality of shisha and fresh juices that were served was perfect. The staff is very helpful and knowledgable about the menu. One last thing they also provide complimentary termes (ترمس).
Nice and small place in an elite residential area. Indoor and outdoor.
